text: It’s not very clear what you are asking but are you trying to pull data from child pages to their parent page?

Sorry! Its not clear to you!
Actually I want to add the filter dropdown on webpage. Like Our service, Work, home etc... For that first I need to categorized my Website pages. So, can you tell me that is there any way where i can define the category to website page during creation?
Ah I see. No, there is no way by default. You would need a custom module for this
Yes, I know that.. But for custom I also dont get visibility that how i can add the property in HubSpot website page
can you please share your knowledge regarding this.. It would be helpful if you suggest something
You could create a custom module called “page options”, place this module in every page template and within that module you would have options to select a Service Type.
can you please share any reference link for code?

Hi guys !
How can I create a custom field for all the users?
I want to add a salutation for every user and then use that salutation in a custom quote template.

What’s something regarding HubSpot & HubSpot development that you’d wish you had known when starting out? Or something that wasn’t clear and didn’t make sense for a long time until your “Aha!” moment?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
